Ingest_LDD.name: Mars 2020 Mission
Ingest_LDD.comment:
The Mars 2020 mission dictionary contains classes and attributes specific to the Mars 2020 (Perseverance Rover) mission and its instruments.
Mars 2020 version 1.0.0.0 PDS Build 1.15.0.0 LDDTool version 12.1.0
Built with LDDTool -plJ PDS4_IMG_Ingest_LDD.xml PDS4_MARS2020_IngestLDD.xml
2020-07-29 Confirmed spacecraft clock count notation (Bob Deen) 2020-08-11 Revised some attribute names to be consistent with msn discipline dictionary, for efficient searches: product_type_name replaces product_type release_number replaces release_id (but it is still an ASCII string) spacecraft_clock_start replaces spacecraft_clock_start_count spacecraft_clock_stop replaces spacecraft_clock_stop_count spacecraft_clock_partition replaces spacecraft_clock_count_partition start_local_true_solar_time_sol and stop_local_true_solar_time_sol replace local_true_solar_time_sol 2020-08-19 Removed enumerated values list for product_type_name, until we know what values to use, if any 2020-08-20 Changed mars2020:error:sclk_rule_0 to allow spacecraft_clock_start and stop to be evaluated independently 2020-08-25 Added container class Mars2020_Parameters 2020-08-28 Added classes PIXL_Illumination and SuperCam_RMI_Mini_Header and their attributes, from Bob Deen 2020-10-21 Built with IM 1.15.0.0. Added RIMFAX_Parameters classes and attributes. 2020-10-28 Made a few adjustments for RIMFAX (removed second delay parameters and removed number in the name of the remaining delay parameters). Moved position of rfax_setup_file to match its location in the ODL labels. Added attribute active_flight_computer to Observation_Information class. 2020-12-29 Changed max occurrences of PIXL_Illumination class from 1 to 2. Corrected pattern for rules mars2020:error:ltst_rule_0 and mars2020:error:ltst_rule_1. 2020-12-30 Add MOXIE_Parameters classes and attributes 2021-01-20 Added SHERLOC Calibration_Target class 2021-01-22 Added more PIXL_Parameters classes and attributes 2021-01-26 Made PIXL attributes both nillable and optional 2021-03-10 Changed attribute mars2020:unit to optional in MOXIE classes Run_Control_Table_Field, Algorithm_Parameter_Table_Field, Safety_Parameter_Table_Field, and Run_Parameter_Table_Field. Added start_mars_year and stop_mars_year to mars2020:Observation_Information to support MOXIE. Changed MOXIE attribute names *_enable to *_en. 2021-03-30 Changed spacecraft_clock_start and spacecraft_clock_stop to allow a fraction up to 9 digits (was 6) 2021-04-07 Added classes SuperCam_Generic_Packet_Header, SuperCam_Ancillary_Header, and their attributes

DD_Attribute.name: active_flight_computer
DD_Attribute.definition: The active_flight_computer indicates which flight computer "string" (separate sets of electronics) was active when a product was acquired. For Mars 2020 there are two redundant flight computers called "strings", also known as Rover Compute Elements (RCEs). Either string, A or B, may be active at any given time.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The value "A" indicates flight computer A.
The value "B" indicates flight computer B.

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The mission_phase_name identifies a time period within the mission.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The ATLO mission phase (Assembly, Test, and Launch Operations) is the time of spacecraft and instrument assembly and test. During this phase data products are generated using flight hardware. They are usually not part of the final PDS archive but may be used for testing and peer review.

The cruise mission phase is from the time of escape from Earth's orbit through the time of entry into Mars' orbit. Some data products may be generated during this time, including instrument checkout data.

The development mission phase refers to the period of data processing software development and testing, before instruments are integrated with the spacecraft. Data products generated during this phase are usually not part of the final PDS archive but may be used for testing and peer review.
The surface mission phase is the time from arrival at Mars through the end of surface operations, including the primary mission and any extended missions that may take place.
The test mission phase is not a time period but a placeholder for the mission_phase_name value, used for test data products.

DD_Attribute.name: product_type_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_type_name identifies a group of data products within a collection that have some property in common, such as processing level, resolution, or instrument-specific setting.

DD_Attribute.name: release_number
DD_Attribute.definition: release_number is the identifier of a scheduled release of Mars 2020 data from PDS. The first Mars 2020 data release has release_number "01". The release_number for a given product is always the first release in which it appears, and does not change if the product is revised later.

DD_Attribute.name: sol_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Sol_number is the number of the Mars day on which an observation was acquired. Landing day is Sol 0.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_partition provides the clock partition active for the spacecraft_clock_start and spacecraft_clock_stop attributes. This attribute may be used when the spacecraft_clock values do not include a partition number.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_start
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_start is the value of the spacecraft clock at the beginning of an observation, in seconds. Values are formed according to the pattern [p/]dddddddddd[.fffffffff], where p is an optional partition number, dddddddddd is a whole number of seconds up to 10 digits, and .fffffffff is an optional fraction of a second up to 9 digits. The whole number and fraction are separated by a period. If a partition number and slash are not present, then the attribute spacecraft_clock_partition must be used.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [p/]dddddddddd[.fffffffff] - The spacecraft clock value is an integer with no more than 10 digits, optionally preceded by a clock partition number and forward slash, and optionally followed by a fractional value. If the fractional value is present, it must be separated from the whole number by a period, and may have up to 9 digits. If a partition number and slash are not present, then the attribute spacecraft_clock_partition must be used.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_stop
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_stop is the value of the spacecraft clock at the end of an observation, in seconds. Values are formed according to the pattern [p/]dddddddddd[.fffffffff], where p is an optional partition number, dddddddddd is a whole number of seconds up to 10 digits, and .fffffffff is an optional fraction of a second up to 9 digits. The whole number and fraction are separated by a period. If a partition number and slash are not present, then the attribute spacecraft_clock_partition must be used.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [p/]dddddddddd[.fffffffff] - The spacecraft clock value is an integer with no more than 10 digits, optionally preceded by a clock partition number and forward slash, and optionally followed by a fractional value. If the fractional value is present, it must be separated from the whole number by a period, and may have up to 9 digits. If a partition number and slash are not present, then the attribute spacecraft_clock_partition must be used.

DD_Attribute.name: start_local_mean_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_local_mean_solar_time is the local mean solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the beginning of an observation.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [Sol-]nnnnnMhh:mm:ss[.fffff] - Local mean solar time is given as a sol number with no more than 5 digits, optionally preceded by "Sol-", followed by a time in hours, minutes, and seconds, which is optionally followed by a decimal point and fractional seconds. The sol number and time are separated by an uppercase M.

DD_Attribute.name: start_local_true_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_local_true_solar_time is the local true solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the beginning of an observation.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [[Sol-]nnnnn ]hh:mm:ss[.fffff] - Local true solar time is given in hours, minutes and seconds, optionally followed by a decimal point and fractional seconds. The time may be preceded by "nnnnn " or "Sol-nnnnn " where nnnnn is the sol number, separated from the time by a space character. If no sol number is present, the attribute start_local_true_solar_time_sol should be used to specify the sol number.

DD_Attribute.name: start_local_true_solar_time_sol
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_local_true_solar_time_sol element specifies the number of solar days elapsed since a reference day (e.g. the day on which a landing vehicle set down) for local true solar time (LTST). Days are measured in rotations of the planet in question from midnight to midnight. The reference day is '0', as Landing day is Sol 0. If before Landing day, then value will be less than or equal to '0' and can be negative. Start_local_true_solar_time_sol should accompany the attribute start_local_true_solar_time if that attribute's value does not include a sol number prefix.

DD_Attribute.name: start_mars_year
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_mars_year element gives the Mars year at the beginning of the observation. Mars Year 1 began on April 11, 1955. The year number is incremented by 1 for each Martian spring equinox (solar longitude 0 degrees).

DD_Attribute.name: start_sol_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_sol_number is the number of the Mars day on which a multiple-day observation was begun. Landing day is Sol 0.
DD_Attribute.comment: Start/stop_sol_number are provided as an alternative to sol_number for observations that cross one or more sol boundaries.

DD_Attribute.name: start_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Start_solar_longitude is the solar longitude, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the beginning of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_local_mean_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_local_mean_solar_time is the local mean solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the end of an observation.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [Sol-]nnnnnMhh:mm:ss[.fffff] - Local mean solar time is given as a sol number with no more than 5 digits, optionally preceded by "Sol-", followed by a time in hours, minutes, and seconds, which is optionally followed by a decimal point and fractional seconds. The sol number and time are separated by an uppercase M.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_local_true_solar_time
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_local_true_solar_time is the local true solar time, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the end of an observation.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [[Sol-]nnnnn ]hh:mm:ss[.fffff] - Local true solar time is given in hours, minutes and seconds, optionally followed by a decimal point and fractional seconds. The time may be preceded by "nnnnn " or "Sol-nnnnn " where nnnnn is the sol number, separated from the time by a space character. If no sol number is present, the attribute stop_local_true_solar_time_sol should be used to specify the sol number.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_local_true_solar_time_sol
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_local_true_solar_time_sol element specifies the number of solar days elapsed since a reference day (e.g. the day on which a landing vehicle set down) for local true solar time (LTST). Days are measured in rotations of the planet in question from midnight to midnight. The reference day is '0', as Landing day is Sol 0. If before Landing day, then value will be less than or equal to '0' and can be negative. Stop_local_true_solar_time_sol should accompany the attribute stop_local_true_solar_time if that attribute's value does not include a sol number prefix.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_mars_year
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_mars_year element gives the Mars year at the end of the observation. Mars Year 1 began on April 11, 1955. The year number is incremented by 1 for each Martian spring equinox (solar longitude 0 degrees).

DD_Attribute.name: stop_sol_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_sol_number is the number of the Mars day on which a multiple-day observation was ended. Landing day is Sol 0.
DD_Attribute.comment: Start/stop_sol_number are provided as an alternative to sol_number for observations that cross one or more sol boundaries.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop_solar_longitude is the solar longitude, as defined in the main PDS4 data dictionary, at the end of an observation.

DD_Attribute.name: file_name_stem

DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack voltage safety limit persistence time

DD_Attribute.name: step_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: Step duration

DD_Attribute.name: step_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: Step number

DD_Attribute.name: tl_ics1234_h_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: Gas composition sensors CS1, CS2, CS3 and CS4 upper temperature limit in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: tl_ics1234_h_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: Gas composition sensors CS1, CS2, CS3 and CS4 upper temperature limit in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: tl_ics1234_t
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: Gas composition sensors CS1, CS2, CS3 and CS4 temperature limit persistence time

DD_Attribute.name: vb_en
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack power supply enable bit

DD_Attribute.name: vt_en
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack power supply enable bit

DD_Attribute.name: zib_h_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop voltage output upper limit in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zib_h_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop voltage output upper limit in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zib_i_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop integral gain in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zib_i_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop integral gain in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zib_l_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop voltage output lower limit in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zib_l_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop voltage output lower limit in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zib_os_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop voltage offset in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zib_os_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop voltage offset in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zib_p_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop proportional gain in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zib_p_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop proportional gain in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zib_sp_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop setpoint in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zib_sp_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE bottom half-stack current control loop setpoint in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zit_h_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop voltage output upper limit in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zit_h_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop voltage output upper limit in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zit_i_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop integral gain in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zit_i_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop integral gain in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.name: zit_l_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop voltage output lower limit in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zit_l_digital_number
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop voltage output lower limit in digital numbers

DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop voltage offset in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE top half-stack current control loop setpoint in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: zp4_h_calibrated
DD_Attribute.definition: For MOXIE: SOXE cathode pressure control loop scroll compressor RPM output upper limit in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: current_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The current_value attribute provides provides the current, in the specified units, of an imaging instrument or some part of the imaging instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: device_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The device_name attribute supplies the formal name for an imaging instrument, an imaging instrument device, or some point on the instrument or device.

DD_Attribute.name: flash_duration
DD_Attribute.definition: The flash_duration attribute provides the duration of a single component of the flash for the PIXL MCC illumination.

DD_Attribute.name: inst_compression_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: The inst_compression_mode identifies the type of compression applied to a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: inst_compression_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The inst_compression_name gives the name of the compression algorithm applied to a data product.

DD_Attribute.name: pdp_category
DD_Attribute.definition: The pdp_category identifies the PIXL data product category number.

DD_Attribute.name: pdp_category_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The pdp_category_name identifies the PIXL data product category name.

DD_Attribute.name: pdp_nvm_block
DD_Attribute.definition: The pdp_nvm_block identifies the Non Volatile Memory block from which Anomalous Retrieved data was read. Applies only to anomalous data.

DD_Attribute.name: pdp_nvm_chunks
DD_Attribute.definition: The pdp_nvm_chunks gives the number of Non Volatile Memory chunks that make up a PIXL data product.

DD_Attribute.name: pdp_nvm_page
DD_Attribute.definition: The pdp_nvm_page identifies the page in Non Volatile Memory from which Anomalous Retrieved Data was read. Applies only to anomalous data.

DD_Attribute.name: pdp_nvm_usn
DD_Attribute.definition: The pdp_nvm_usn gives the Universal Sequence Number of the data product as it was stored in Non-Volatile Memory.

DD_Attribute.name: pdp_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The pdp_size gives the size of the PIXL data product as it was stored in Non-Volatile Memory.

DD_Attribute.name: pixl_motion_counter
DD_Attribute.definition: The PIXL Motion Counter is a counter representing a change to the PIXL Hexapod position. The counter starts at 0 when PIXL is powered on (presumably with the hexapod in the "homed" position) and increases by 1 each time the hexapod is moved.

DD_Attribute.name: temperature_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The temperature_value attribute provides the temperature, in the specified units, of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging instrument device.

DD_Attribute.name: voltage_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The voltage_value attribute provides provides the voltage, in the specified units, of an imaging instrument or some part of the imaging instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: calibration
DD_Attribute.definition: True if the radar is connected to the calibration cable, false if it is connected to the antenna cable.
DD_Attribute.comment: Allowable values are 'true' or 'false' for Boolean types

DD_Attribute.name: config_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The config ID from the sounding data.

DD_Attribute.name: decimation
DD_Attribute.definition: TBD
DD_Attribute.comment: Value is always an integer in test products.

DD_Attribute.name: gate_frequency
DD_Attribute.definition: TBD.

DD_Attribute.name: group_spacing
DD_Attribute.definition: TBD
DD_Attribute.comment: Mats: I'm not sure what this is.

DD_Attribute.name: lis_soundings
DD_Attribute.definition: The number of soundings in a Long Integration Sounding (LIS) observation.

DD_Attribute.name: note
DD_Attribute.definition: This note field can be used to indicate that the attenuation values are in dB because there is no unit_of_measure for such units.

DD_Attribute.name: number_of_samples
DD_Attribute.definition: Number of samples in each sounding.

DD_Attribute.name: number_of_sweeps
DD_Attribute.definition: Number of sweeps that are integrated internally in the radar.

DD_Attribute.name: receive_only
DD_Attribute.definition: True if the radar is in passive mode, false if it is in active (normal radar) mode.
DD_Attribute.comment: Allowable values are 'true' or 'false' for Boolean types

DD_Attribute.name: rx_attenuation
DD_Attribute.definition: The value set for the programmable receiver attenuator.

DD_Attribute.name: rx_delay
DD_Attribute.definition: Delay for switching the Rx switch on and off.

DD_Attribute.name: setup_file
DD_Attribute.definition: Name of the setup file.

DD_Attribute.name: sinetable
DD_Attribute.definition: TBD
DD_Attribute.comment: Mats: I'm not sure what the value should be here. A hash of the sinetable? A date?

DD_Attribute.name: start_frequency
DD_Attribute.definition: Start frequency for the FMCW sweep.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_frequency
DD_Attribute.definition: Stop frequency for the FMCW sweep.

DD_Attribute.name: sweep_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The sweep time for each integrated sweep.

DD_Attribute.name: time_cut_samples
DD_Attribute.definition: TBD
DD_Attribute.comment: This does not appear to be used.

DD_Attribute.name: tx_attenuation
DD_Attribute.definition: The value set for the programmable transmitter attenuator.

DD_Attribute.name: tx_delay
DD_Attribute.definition: Delay for switching the Tx switch on and off.

DD_Attribute.name: calibration_target_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The calibration_target_name gives the name of the calibration target as defined in the SHERLOC instrument paper, Bhartia et al., SSR, 2020. Each calibration target name is associated with a calibration target number: (0) NA (1) AlGaN on Sapphire 264 nm (2) Diffusil Diffuser (3) Mars Meteorite SAU 008 (4) Intensity Target (5) AlGaN on Sapphire 340 nm (6) Polycarbonate/opal glass (7) Vectran (8) Orthofabric (9) Teflon (10) nGimat Coated Teflon

DD_Attribute.name: calibration_target_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The calibration_target_name gives the number of the calibration target as defined in the SHERLOC instrument paper, Bhartia et al., SSR, 2020. Each calibration target number is associated with a calibration target name: (0) Not Applicable (1) AlGaN on Sapphire 264 nm (2) Diffusil Diffuser (3) Mars Meteorite SAU 008 (4) Intensity Target (5) AlGaN on Sapphire 340 nm (6) Polycarbonate/opal glass) (7) Vectran (8) Orthofabric (9) Teflon (10) nGimat Coated Teflon

DD_Attribute.name: sherloc_config_file
DD_Attribute.definition: The sherloc_config_file provides the name of the configuration file used to process a SHERLOC data product.

DD_Attribute.name: bu_hardware_identifier
DD_Attribute.definition: Hardware identifier for a specific BU CNDH board. Used to know which SOH engineering unit conversion factors to apply to the data.

DD_Attribute.name: bu_software_version
DD_Attribute.definition: Unique identifier for the software version. Is a unix timestamp of when the software was built.

DD_Attribute.name: cndh_firmware_version
DD_Attribute.definition: Unique identifier for the CNDH firmware version. Is a unix timestamp of when the firmware was built.

DD_Attribute.name: data_definition_version
DD_Attribute.definition: Version number of the instrument command dictionary, which defines specifics of each command parameter, and the structure of individual data products like SOH.

DD_Attribute.name: data_length
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the size of the image (in the telemetry stream) in bytes for SuperCam RMI.

DD_Attribute.name: generic_data_buffer_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The number of bytes of the entire generic buffer. Includes commands, data, header, and trailer, every byte from the packet header marker through the Fletcher checksum.

DD_Attribute.name: marker_pad
DD_Attribute.definition: Static value used by the SuperCam RMI Body Unit (BU).

DD_Attribute.name: memory_bank
DD_Attribute.definition: For SuperCam RMI this specifies the Mast Unit (MU) memory bank used to hold image before transfer to RCE. There are 64 memory banks in the MU.

DD_Attribute.name: milliseconds_count
DD_Attribute.definition: Millisecond count from RCE time sync when image received from mast unit by SuperCam RMI.

DD_Attribute.name: mu_hardware_identifier
DD_Attribute.definition: Hardware identifier for a specific MU board. Used to know which housekeeping engineering unit conversion factors to apply to the data.

DD_Attribute.name: mu_version_identifier
DD_Attribute.definition: Version of the MU, response from the MU send version command.

DD_Attribute.name: num_images_transmitted
DD_Attribute.definition: For SuperCam RMI, this is the number of images transmitted to the RCE.

DD_Attribute.name: number_of_sections
DD_Attribute.definition: Number of command or data sections contained in this buffer. Does not include the header section or the trailer section.

DD_Attribute.name: nv_xmit_buffer_count
DD_Attribute.definition: Non-volatile count of the number of times the generic buffer has been transmitted to the RCE. Acts as a unique identifier for the buffer.

DD_Attribute.name: rce_time_sync
DD_Attribute.definition: Last time sync value received from RCE by SuperCam RMI

DD_Attribute.name: reserved_1
DD_Attribute.definition: Reserved field for SuperCam RMI mini-header

DD_Attribute.name: reserved_2
DD_Attribute.definition: Reserved field for SuperCam RMI mini-header

DD_Attribute.name: rmi_cmos_registers
DD_Attribute.definition: Dump of SuperCam RMI hardware registers

DD_Attribute.name: rmi_fpga_registers
DD_Attribute.definition: Dump of all SuperCam RMI FPGA registers

DD_Attribute.name: rmi_header_size
DD_Attribute.definition: For SuperCam RMI this is the total number of bytes in MU and BU headers

DD_Attribute.name: scam_lastats_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Logical to indicate if LIBS active are statistics

DD_Attribute.name: scam_ldark
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates whether darks were collected after LIBS active, before LIBS active, or both

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: No darks collected
Darks collected after LIBS active
Darks collected before LIBS active
Darks collected both before and after LIBS active

DD_Attribute.name: scam_ldstats_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Logical to indicate if LIBS dark are statistics

DD_Attribute.name: scam_point_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Point number in the raster

DD_Attribute.name: scam_rastats_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Logical to indicate if Raman active are statistics

DD_Attribute.name: scam_rdark
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates whether darks were collected after Raman active, before Raman active, or both

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: No darks collected
Darks collected after Raman active
Darks collected before Raman active
Darks collected both before and after Raman active

DD_Attribute.name: scam_rdstats_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Logical to indicate if Raman darks are statistics

DD_Attribute.name: scam_two_d_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Flag indicating a 2D collect

DD_Attribute.name: scam_type
DD_Attribute.definition: Bit mask indicating technique type

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: TBD by Dot

DD_Attribute.name: se_firmware_version
DD_Attribute.definition: Unique identifier for the SE firmware version. Is a unix timestamp of when the firmware was built.

DD_Attribute.name: se_hardware_identifier
DD_Attribute.definition: Hardware identifier for a specific SE board. Used to know which SOH engineering unit conversion factors to apply to the data.

DD_Attribute.name: xmit_data_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The data_id parameter sent with the XMIT_DATA command

DD_Class.name: Observation_Information
DD_Class.definition: The Observation_Information class provides information about a science observation.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The data product has an associated ancillary data product identified by the given LID.
The data product has an associated ancillary data product identified by the given LID.
The data product has an associated ancillary data product identified by the given LID.
The data product has an associated ancillary data product identified by the given LID.

DD_Class.name: MOXIE_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The MOXIE_Parameters class provides metadata specific to MOXIE observations.

DD_Class.name: Device_Current
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Current class provides the current of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Currents
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Currents class provides a container for the set of currents of an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Flash
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Flash class provides the duration of a single identified component of the flash for the PIXL MCC illumination.

DD_Class.name: Device_Flashes
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Flashes class provides a container for the set of flash durations for the PIXL MCC illumination.

DD_Class.name: Device_Temperature
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Temperature class provides a container for the temperature of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Temperatures
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Temperatures class provides a container for the set of temperatures of an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Voltage
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Voltage class provides the voltage of some point on an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: Device_Voltages
DD_Class.definition: The Device_Voltage class provides a container for the set of voltages of an imaging instrument or other imaging device.

DD_Class.name: PIXL_Illumination
DD_Class.definition: Container class containing information related to the illumination devices on PIXL. There are two, flood light and structured light. Note that some of the illumination is in the img:Illumination class; the information here is instrument-specific information that does not fit into the img: framework.

DD_Class.name: PIXL_Compression
DD_Class.definition: The PIXL Compression class provides information about the compression applied to the data product.

DD_Class.name: PIXL_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The PIXL Parameters class provides metadata specific to PIXL observations.

DD_Class.name: RIMFAX_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Container for the attributes describing a RIMFAX observation

DD_Class.name: Calibration_Target
DD_Class.definition: The Calibration_Target class contains information about the target of a calibration measurement.

DD_Class.name: SHERLOC_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Container for the attributes describing a SHERLOC observation

DD_Class.name: SuperCam_RMI_Mini_Header
DD_Class.definition: This class contains the "mini-header" for the SuperCam RMI camera on Mars 2020. The mini- header is a set of information that is tightly tied to the camera hardware, and the instrument team finds value in keeping the set of mini- header information together. Much (but not all) of the information is also included in appropriate sections of the discipline dictionaries, which is where general users should go.

DD_Class.name: SuperCam_Ancillary_Header
DD_Class.definition: The SuperCam_Ancillary_Header class provides ancillary metadata specific to SuperCam observations.

DD_Class.name: SuperCam_Generic_Packet_Header
DD_Class.definition: The SuperCam Generic_Packet_Header class provides metadata from the SuperCam product generic packet header.

DD_Class.name: SuperCam_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The SuperCam_Parameters class provides metadata specific to SuperCam observations.

DD_Class.name: Mars2020_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Mars2020_Parameters class is a superclass containing all Mars2020 mission classes.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ( (mars2020:spacecraft_clock_partition) or (contains(mars2020:spacecraft_clock_start, '/')) or ( (not (mars2020:spacecraft_clock_partition)) and (not (mars2020:spacecraft_clock_start)) ) ) then true() else false()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mars2020:error:sclk_rule_0: If mars2020:spacecraft_clock_start is present, it must begin with a partition number followed by a forward slash, OR the partition number must be given by mars2020:spacecraft_clock_partition.
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_description: If spacecraft_clock_start is present, it must begin with a partition number followed by a forward slash, OR the partition number must be given by spacecraft_clock_partition.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ( (mars2020:spacecraft_clock_partition) or (contains(mars2020:spacecraft_clock_stop, '/')) or ( (not (mars2020:spacecraft_clock_partition)) and (not (mars2020:spacecraft_clock_stop)) ) ) then true() else false()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mars2020:error:sclk_rule_1: If mars2020:spacecraft_clock_stop is present, it must begin with a partition number followed by a forward slash, OR the partition number must be given by mars2020:spacecraft_clock_partition.
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_description: If spacecraft_clock_stop is present, it must begin with a partition number followed by a forward slash, OR the partition number must be given by spacecraft_clock_partition.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mars2020:error:ltst_rule_0: If mars2020:start_local_true_solar_time is present, it must include a sol number as in 'Sol-nnnnn hh:mm:ss[.fffff]', OR the sol number must be given by mars2020:start_local_true_solar_time_sol.
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_description: If start_local_true_solar_time is present, it must include a sol number, or the sol number must be given by start_local_true_solar_time_sol. [[Sol-]nnnnn ]hh:mm:ss[.fffff]

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mars2020:error:ltst_rule_1: If mars2020:stop_local_true_solar_time is present, it must include a sol number as in 'Sol-nnnnn hh:mm:ss[.fffff]', OR the sol number must be given by mars2020:stop_local_true_solar_time_sol.
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_description: If stop_local_true_solar_time is present, it must include a sol number, or the sol number must be given by stop_local_true_solar_time_sol. [[Sol-]nnnnn ]hh:mm:ss[.fffff]

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mars2020:error:solnumber_rule_0: The mars2020:Observation_Information class must include either the attribute mars2020:sol_number or the pair of attributes mars2020:start_sol_number and mars2020:stop_sol_number.
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_description: Either sol_number or the pair start_sol_number and stop_sol_number must be present.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mars2020:error:solnumber_rule_1: If either of the pair mars2020:start_sol_number and mars2020:stop_sol_number is present, then both must be present.
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_description: If either of the pair start_sol_number and stop_sol_number is present, then both must be present.
